p: Furthermore, the extract was more potent on acetic acid induced vascular permeability in mice than diclofenac. In this model, acetic acid causes an increase in the level of histamine in peritoneal fluids, serotonin, and prostaglandins, which leads to vasodilation of blood vessels and an increase in vascular permeability in the peritoneal cavity [ 18]. The current study indicates that the extract can prevent vasodilation and inhibit the release of inflammatory mediators in the acute vascular phase of inflammation. Different compounds from A. zerumbet fruit essential oil showed anti-inflammatory effects against dimethylbenzene-induced ear edema in rats when compared to aspirin [ 19].
